text: I remember rocking out to this lol. I even recorded it on a tape deck son I can listen to it all the time lol.
author: PRChingon

text: Tim Follin knew how to get the absolute most out of any limited sound chip. His song from the game Chronos on the ZX spectrum is nothing short of audio sorcery. Look it up, and then imagine THAT coming out of your 1-channel motherboard beeper, since that's all the sound hardware he had to work with. Every sound was the result of hand-mixing the audio in software.

text: I immediately knew that this was a Follin song by the start of the song.  Does anyone think it's a stretch to say that Follin was a genius composer on limited hardware specifically NES and Gameboy music?

text: I'm pretty sure Tim Follin never made a Game Boy soundtrack (except Bust-a-move 4 on the GBC, which sounds absolutely nothing like him). But his brother Geoff made a few Game Boy soundtracks.

author: doomi92y

text: Seeing NES cartridges always brings back nostalgic memories... memories of them working half the time and having to blow and use our own uniquely weird technique to make them work. This game was a slightly above average beat 'em up elevated by Tim Follin's rocking soundtrack.
author: SupraDarky
